content.raw:
In my understanding, Coriolis and centripetal terms are accelerations, not forces. They typically arise from differentiating body-fixed velocities with rotating frames. If a world-frame velocity is differentiated, then these terms don't arise.

Also, if acceleration is computed from forces via `a = F / m`, then those terms don't have any affect there either.
content.html:
In my understanding, Coriolis and centripetal terms are accelerations, not forces. They typically arise from differentiating body-fixed velocities with rotating frames. If a world-frame velocity is differentiated, then these terms don't arise.

Also, if acceleration is computed from forces via a = F / m, then those terms don't have any affect there either.
